subNodes.conversationText: root
The ghost speaks in a deep, earthy tone: "Have you come seeking knowledge?"
"Tell me about this place."

"You stand in the library of the Great Temple of the Great City of Eberen. For two hundred years this library was a place of learning and research, of enlightenment. Much of the history of the world can be found in this place. The Elderin relied on this place for their knowledge."
"What happened to it? What happened to the Elderin?"

"With enlightenment comes fear.... there is always so much to fear."  

The ghost trails off. 

"The people you call Elderin abandoned the city of Ereben. They feared... what they found below the temple."
"What did they find below the temple?"
"The records are lost.... or destroyed. The knowledge is lost."
"I want to ask about something else."
The ghost speaks in a deep, earthy tone: "Have you come seeking knowledge?"
"Who are you?"

"I am the Archivist. My name is.... was...."

The ghost trails off.
"Your name is Lor Rulian. I found your portrait in the Library."

The ghost is silent for a long time.

"Rulian. Yes. I am Lor Rulian. Thank you.That knowledge had been lost. You brought it back. You brought me back."
"How did you die?"

"I remember now. When the elders decided to escape into the darkness below, I stayed to tend to the Library. I thought they would come back. Surely... they will come back."

The spirit pauses. 

"I was lonely for a long time. Eventually I must have died."
"Not entirely. How did you come back?"

"Many moons back, an elven necromancer called Azzerakin entered the temple seeking the knowledge of the Elderin. She raised spirits to help her." 

"She called me back from the Void to find the secrets of the Great Library."
"But the zombies look fresh. They aren't spirits."

"She did not come alone. She brought experiments."

The ghost trails off.

"Not all of her experiments worked."
"How do I fight the spirits? How do I kill the wraiths?"

"Spirits can only be hurt by pure magical energy. Magical energy can destroy them. They can also be hurt by certain weapons. Take the Mace of Disruption in the chest by the wall, and use it to kill them."
"Where is Azzerakin?"

"She is in the Lower Crypts."

The voice is more distant. The spirit is fading before your eyes. It is finally returning to rest in the Void.

Your time is short.
"What is she doing?"

"She is studying an inert Elderin Stone. The thought of death frightens her and she is seeking a way of achieving immortality."

The spirit pauses. 

"Ahh, yes. I remember. She has done a deal with the Vandrid. It will claim her when she dies. She is very, very scared. She is desperate to uncover the secret of the stone, but she cannot fathom it. She is growing mad with fear."

You sense the archivist is smiling.
"What is the Vandrid?"
"The demon. The demon that corrupted and terrified the Elderin and drove them underground."
"You said the Elderin Stone is inert. What did you mean?"
"The stone is inert. It will not react to Azzerakin's magic. She cannot provide it with the power that it needs to become active."
"Is an inert stone completely useless?"

"Completely. Creating an active stone was one of the great arts of the Elderin."

A ghostly smile passes across Lor Rulian's face.

"Ah, yes. Her assistant understands the secrets of the stone but has not told her. She does not know. I find that very satisfying."
"How do I make an Elderin Stone active?"
"You must trap a Great Soul within it. That is what Azzerakin does not know."
"A Great Soul?"
"Yes. Killing a creature with a Great Soul in the presence of the stone will complete the creation process."
"Where do I find a creature with a Great Soul?"

The Archivist pauses. 

"There is such a creature nearby. But it is below the temple, not within it."
"Below the temple? What's below the temple?"

"A great city. A trap. One built by the Elderin for their own imprisonment, although they didn't know it. The Vandrid tricked them down there centuries ago and tortured them. It tortures them still. It will torture them for all time, for amusement."

The spirit pauses. "This is why they didn't come back. Of course. I remember. They didn't abandon me, they were trapped. I tried to free them, but the Vandrid.... it was so strong..." 

His voice trails off.
"Is the Vandrid the creature with the Great Soul?"

The spirit pauses for a long time.

"Yes," he says sadly. "You will need to fight the Vandrid if you want to power the stone. It has the Great Soul. But it is very strong. So very strong. And I cannot help you. I am sorry."

The spirit is very faint now. It is nearly gone.
"How do I fight the Vandrid? How do I kill a demon?"
The spirit has gone.
Continue
"I've looking for an Elderin Stone."
"You will not find an active stone. They are not to be found."
"What do you mean?"
"The Elderin Stone is made, not found. It is a construct. It is one of the arts of the Elderin."
"How do I make an Elderin Stone?"
"You must find an inert stone and trap a Great Soul within it."
"A Great Soul?"
"Yes. Killing one with a Great Soul in the presence of an Elderin Stone will complete the creation process."
"Where do I find a creature with a Great Soul?"

The Archivist pauses. 

"There is a Great Soul nearby. But it is below the temple, not within."
"Below the temple? What's below the temple?"

The archivist frowns.

"I... I don't remember. There are no records of it. That knowledge is lost."
"Where do I find an inactive Elderin Stone?"
"There is one in the temple. It is in the Lower Crypts."
"I want to ask about something else."
The ghost speaks in a deep, earthy tone: "Have you come seeking knowledge?"
"How do I kill wraiths?"
"With magic. There are records. This knowledge is in the Library."
"Where is the book that tells me this information?"

The ghost reflects.

"In the eastern section."
"I want to ask about something else."
The ghost speaks in a deep, earthy tone: "Have you come seeking knowledge?"
"No. Gold."
"There is little gold in the Temple of Eberen."
"What about other treasures?"
"You stand in a place of great learning. Knowledge is all around you. This is your treasure."
"I want to ask about something else."
The ghost speaks in a deep, earthy tone: "Have you come seeking knowledge?"
[Leave the ghost]
The ghost speaks in a deep, earthy tone: "Have you come seeking knowledge?"
"Tell me about this place."

"You stand in the library of the Great Temple of the city of Ereben. For two hundred years this library was a place of learning and research, of enlightenment. Much of the history of the world can be found in this place. The people of Ereben relied on this place for their knowledge."
"What happened to it? What happened to the Elderin?"

"With enlightenment comes fear.... there is always so much to fear."  

The ghost trails off. 

"The people you call Elderin abandoned the city of Ereben. They feared... what they found below the temple."
"What did they find below the temple?"

The archivist frowns.

"I... I don't remember. The records are lost. Or were they destroyed? In any event, the knowledge is lost."
"I want to ask about something else."
The ghost speaks in a deep, earthy tone: "Have you come seeking knowledge?"
"Who are you?"

"I am the Archivist. My name is.... was...."

The ghost trails off.
"When did you die?"

The ghost is silent for a long time.

"I don't remember. There are no records of it. That knowledge is lost."
"Why is this floor flooded with undead?"
"Azzerakin."
"What's an Azzerakin?"
"An Elven necromancer. She entered the temple many moons ago seeking the knowledge of the Elderin. She has raised many spirits in this persuit."
"But the zombies look fresh. They aren't spirits."

"She did not come alone. She brought... experiments."

The ghost trails off.

"Not all of her experiments worked."
"Where is she?"

The ghost pauses, reflecting.

"She is in the Lower Crypts."
"I want to ask about something else."
The ghost speaks in a deep, earthy tone: "Have you come seeking knowledge?"
"I've looking for an Elderin Stone."
"You will not find an active stone. They are not to be found."
"What do you mean?"
"The Elderin Stone is made, not found. It is a construct. It is one of the arts of the Elderin."
"How do I make an Elderin Stone?"
"You must find an inert stone and trap a Great Soul within it."
"A Great Soul?"
"Yes. Killing one with a Great Soul in the presence of an inert stone will complete the creation process."
"Where do I find a creature with a Great Soul?"

The Archivist pauses. 

"There is a Great Soul nearby. But it is below the temple, not within."
"Below the temple? What's below the temple?"

The archivist frowns.

"I...  I don't remember. There are no records of it. That knowledge is lost."
"Where do I find an inert Elderin Stone?"
"There is one in the temple. It is in the crypts."
"I want to ask about something else."
The ghost speaks in a deep, earthy tone: "Have you come seeking knowledge?"
"How do I kill wraiths?"

"Spirits can only be hurt by pure magical energy. Magical energy can destroy them. They can also be hurt by certain weapons. Take the Mace of Disruption in the chest by the wall, and use it to kill them."
"You'll just let me take it?"
"It is of no use to me."
"I want to ask about something else."
The ghost speaks in a deep, earthy tone: "Have you come seeking knowledge?"
"No. Gold."
"There is little gold in the Temple of Eberen."
"What about other treasures?"
"You stand in a place of great learning. Knowledge is all around you. This is your treasure."
"I want to ask about something else."
The ghost speaks in a deep, earthy tone: "Have you come seeking knowledge?"
[Leave the ghost]
